Detailed Description

Substance pixel formats definitions. Use by texture outputs.

Author:
Christophe Soum - Allegorithmic (christophe.soum@allegorithmic.com)
Note:
This file is part of the Substance engine headers
Date:
20080107

Defines the SubstancePixelFormat and SubstanceChannelsOrder enumerations.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum SubstanceChannelsOrder

Substance channels order in memory enumeration.

Useful on generic platform that put results in system mem (BLEND). 8 bits format. | 2bits: channel A index | 2bits: channel B index | 2bits: channel G index | 2bits: channel R index |

Enumerator:
Substance_ChanOrder_NC  Not applicable
Substance_ChanOrder_RGBA 
Substance_ChanOrder_BGRA 
Substance_ChanOrder_ABGR 
Substance_ChanOrder_ARGB 

enum SubstancePixelFormat

Substance pixel formats enumeration.

A pixel format is stored on 8 bits:

  • 2bits (LSB): RAW/DXT/other format.
  • 3bits: sub-format index (e.g. DXT1/2/3/. etc.).
  • 3bits (MSB): other flags (sRGB, etc.)
Enumerator:
Substance_PF_RAW  Non-compressed flag
Substance_PF_DXT  DXT compression flag
Substance_PF_RGBA  RGBA 4x8bits format
Substance_PF_RGBx  RGBx (3+1:pad)x8bits format
Substance_PF_RGB  RGB 3x8bits format
Substance_PF_L  Luminance 8bits format
Substance_PF_16b  16bits flag
Substance_PF_DXT1  DXT1 format
Substance_PF_DXT2  DXT2 format
Substance_PF_DXT3  DXT3 format
Substance_PF_DXT4  DXT4 format
Substance_PF_DXT5  DXT5 format
Substance_PF_DXTn  DXTn format
Substance_PF_sRGB  sRGB (gamma trans.) flag
